thread.title: How long will Storm Doris last? Weather forecast for Greater Manchester
thread.title_full: How long will Storm Doris last? Weather forecast for Greater Manchester

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: How long will Storm Doris last? Weather forecast for Greater Manchester
text:
News How long will Storm Doris last? Weather forecast for Greater Manchester The Met Office says Storm Doris is a 'weather bomb' and forecasters are warning of more bad conditions to come Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now A windy landing for this Icelandair Boeing 757 Share this video Get daily   
Storm Doris has been battering Greater Manchester, causing travel chaos and damage to roads and buildings. 
After commuters struggled to get to work on Thursday morning, the storm could cause further problems during the evening rush hour. 
An amber weather warning is in place until 8pm. But the good news is, the worst of the storm is likely to pass by mid afternoon, with showers becoming lighter and dying out by about 3pm. 
Wind speeds, which have caused problems for pilots at Manchester Airport, will also gradually begin to die down. Gusts of 50mph are expected across lunchtime but will drop into the high 20s by evening. 
The bad news is, more weather warnings have been issued by the Met Office with icy conditions and snowfall forecast for Friday. Read More LIVE: Storm Doris hits Greater Manchester with heavy rain and 80mph winds forecast 
Patches of ice are expected to form on Manchester’s roads tonight. The Met Office have issued a yellow weather warning of ice, which is in place from 6pm this evening until 9am tomorrow. 
There could also be some wintry showers and up to 3cm of snowfall in hilly areas of the region. A wall collapsed and damaged an Audi Q5 in a car park on Dantzic Street in Manchester city centre. 
A spokesman for the Met Office explained there will be clear skies following on from Storm Doris. This will cause ice to form, while temperatures are expected to plunge to zero overnight. 
Oli Claydon, from the Met Office, said: “The weather warning for tomorrow is for ice. Beyond Storm Doris it will be quite cold after and there will be clear skies. 
“It will be cold later, leading to chilly surfaces tonight.” Read More Storm Doris stops Coronation Street filming because of heavy winds and rain 
The weather warning states: “As the more persistent rain, sleet and snow clears on Thursday afternoon and evening, temperatures will fall quickly and untreated surfaces will freeze, with ice forming, especially in areas with snow cover. 
“Further showers spreading from the west could cause salt wash-off and give further accumulations of snow in places, chiefly on high ground over Scotland.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
